panels.description: It's mix of Line coverage and Branch coverage. Its goal is to provide even more accurate answer to following question: How much source code has been covered by the unit tests?
panels.title: Coverage

panels.description: Duplicated line density. Formula: duplicated_line_density = duplicated_lines / total_lines * 100

panels.description: Total issues
panels.title: Issues

panels.content: Issues in this domain mark your code where you will get bahavior other than what was expected

panels.description: A bug is coding error that will break your code and needs to be fixed immediately
panels.title: Bugs

panels.description: Effort to fix all bug issues

panels.content: Issues in this domain mark potential weakness to hackers
panels.title: Help

panels.description: Security-sensitive code that requires manual review to assess whether or not a vulnerability exists
panels.title: Security Hotspots

panels.description: Vulnerabilities are code that can be exploited by hackers

panels.description: Effort to fix all vulnerability issues

panels.description: Effort to fix all vulnerability issues
panels.title: Remediation

panels.content: Issues in this domain mark your code that will be more difficult to update competently than it should
panels.title: Help

panels.description: Ratio between cost to develop the software and cost to fix it. The formula is: remediation cost / (cost to develop 1 line * number of lines). The value of cost to develop 1 line is 0.06 days
panels.title: Debt Ratio

panels.description: Effort to reach maintainability rating A
panels.title: Effort to reach rating A

panels.description: Code that is confusing and difficult to maintain
panels.title: Code Smells

panels.description: Effort to fix all code smells
panels.title: Technical Debt

panels.description: test_success_density = (total unit tests - test failed - test error) / total unit tests * 100
